intro: Vouapa discolor, commonly known as the Discolored Vouapa, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive white and yellow flowers that bloom during the dry season. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and covered in a fine, velvety texture. Vouapa discolor is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to the arid conditions of its native environment.
